SEURAT.editors
Class RationaleEditorBase

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.commands.common.EventManager
      org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart
          org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart
              SEURAT.editors.RationaleEditorBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.ui.IEditorPart, org.eclipse.ui.IPartListener, org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlternativeEditor, ArgumentEditor, AssumptionEditor, DecisionEditor, GraphicalRationale, PatternDecisionEditor, PatternEditor, QuestionEditor, RequirementEditor, TradeoffEditor
public abstract class RationaleEditorBase
extends org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart
implements org.eclipse.ui.IPartListener

The base class for the new SEURAT rationale editors. Extends the Eclipse EditorPart class, which is a base class for all workbench editors. Also provides common save methods and various helper methods.

Nested Class Summary
 class RationaleEditorBase.ChangeListener
          This class updates the 'dirty' status of the editor to reflect changes made to the form by the user.
 class RationaleEditorBase.SelChangeListener
          This class does the same thing as the ChangeListener but implements the SelectionListener interface instead.

getNeedsSaveListener

public RationaleEditorBase.ChangeListener getNeedsSaveListener()
Get an instance of a ModifyListener subclass which will automatically changed the status of the editor when form elements are modified.

Returns:
An instance of the ChangeListener class

getSelNeedsSaveListener

public RationaleEditorBase.SelChangeListener getSelNeedsSaveListener()
Get an instance of a SelectionListener subclass which will automatically changed the status of the editor.

Returns:
An instance of the SelChangeListener class

getRationaleElement

public abstract RationaleElement getRationaleElement()
Get the rationale element that we are editing. Must be implemented by all subclasses.

saveData

public abstract boolean saveData()
This function is used to save form information to the database, it is called every time the form is saved, regardless of whether the element is being created or just being modified. Implementations should return true after the call to the database and return false at the end of the method (to handle multiple cases where a save might be invalid).

saveNew

public TreeParent saveNew()
This function is used to perform any actions related only to creating new elements. This includes adding the newly created element to the tree.

saveExisting

public void saveExisting()
This function is used to perform any actions specific to editing an element, including updating the task list and making any changes to elements in the rationale tree that have been modified.

editorType

public abstract java.lang.Class editorType()
Get The Class Object Of The Type Of RationaleElement This Editor Supports

Returns:
a class object representing the only RationaleElement type that this editor can edit correctly.

setupForm

public abstract void setupForm(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite pParent)
Creates the editor form.

Parameters:
pParent - The AWT composite component which should be used as the parent of the editor

updateFormCache

protected void updateFormCache()
Called after each save to ensure the editors cache is correctly updated to indicate the values most recently saved.

doSave

public void doSave(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
This function is called by Eclipse when the user attempts to save. Will not do anything if the save is invalid.

Specified by:

getParentElement

public RationaleElement getParentElement()
Helper Method For Retrieving a Properly Casted Instance Of The Rationale Element Which is A Parent to the current one in the rationale tree.

Returns:
a RationaleElement which is the parent of the one being edited

getExplorer

public RationaleExplorer getExplorer()
Helper Method For Finding The Active Rationale Explorer

Returns:
A RationaleExplorer object which is the one that is displaying the RationaleElement being edited

getTreeParent

public TreeParent getTreeParent()
Helper Method For Finding The Tree Element Which owns the current Ratioanle Element

Returns:
return a TreeParent object which is the node in the RationaleExplorer which contains the TreeNode that pertains to the RationaleElement being edited.

isCreating

public boolean isCreating()
Check whether the input of the editor is currently being edited or is currently waiting to be created for the first time.

Returns:
true if the rationale element does not exist in the database and needs created and false if the rationale element is in the database and just needs updated

isDirty

public boolean isDirty()
Used by eclipse to determine whether the editor has been modified since the last save. (If this function returns true the asterisk will be shown next to the filename in the tab)

Specified by:
isDirty in interface org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart
Specified by:
isDirty in class org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart

setDirty

public void setDirty(boolean pDirty)
Set The 'Modified' State of the editor. An editor is dirty if it has been modified since the last save, and therefore must be resaved for any changes to take affect.

Parameters:
pDirty - true if the editor needs resaved and false if the editor has not changed since the last save

init

public void init(org.eclipse.ui.IEditorSite site,
                 org.eclipse.ui.IEditorInput input)
          throws org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException
Sets up some properties of the underlying editor interface and ensures that the editor can display the given information.

Specified by:
init in class org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart
Throws:

doSaveAs

public void doSaveAs()
Save-As is not currently allowed for rationale elements, therefore this function is empty.

Specified by:
doSaveAs in interface org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart
Specified by:
doSaveAs in class org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart

isSaveAsAllowed

public boolean isSaveAsAllowed()
Used by eclipse to decide whether to allow save-as... this is currently disabled for all editors.

Specified by:
isSaveAsAllowed in interface org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart
Specified by:
isSaveAsAllowed in class org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart

setFocus

public void setFocus()
Called When The Editor Recieves Focus, this is currently not used by the base editor

Specified by:
setFocus in interface org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart
Specified by:
setFocus in class org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart

refreshForm

public void refreshForm(RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Call this method to re-load rationale element data from the editor. This function will not do anything if the element has not yet been saved to the database. This function is also not expected to update fields which have been modified but not saved.

Parameters:
pEvent -

closeEditor

public void closeEditor()
Close the editor, generates a partClosed event that invokes the IPartListener interface of this editor also.

onRefreshForm

protected void onRefreshForm(RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Update the fields of the editor with the most current version of that data. If data in the editor has been changed by the user that data is not expected to be changed.

Parameters:
pEvent - the event which caused the editor to need refreshed. This argument must be valid.
